comment.author: 11572312@N00
comment._content: William S. Bennet (spelled with just one t) was a NY Republican politician and congressman, here are some articles: Wikipedia bio: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_S._Bennet query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9B03E5DB1738E633A... He went to bat for a "notorious keeper of a disorderly house" according to this article, which also points out that the congressman spelled his name Bennet, one t. query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9404EEDA163FE6... Seems likely that the other fellow is John J. Lyons (with an s) who was another Republican Politician from NY of this era. Wikipedia article about Lyons: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_J._Lyons NYTimes article mentioning John J. Lyons query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9902E7DB123FE6...
